Fiat Chrysler dan Induk Peugeot Sepakat Merger
01 Nov 2019, 12:03 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi merek Jeep. (CNN Indonesia/Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Fiat ChryslerÂ Automobiles dan pemilik Peugeot, PSA Group, mengumumkan bakal melakukan merger dan mendirikan perusahaan baru. Perusahaan itu masing-masing dimiliki 50 persen oleh pemegang saham kedua produsen.Merger ini, yang disebut akan diresmikan pada beberapa pekan lagi, bakal membuat entitas otomotif baru yang mempekerjakan 410 ribu orang dengan pendapatan gabungan senilai US$190 miliar.Perusahaan baru bakal memiliki kantor pusat di Belanda yang saat ini juga menjadi lokasi markas Fiat Chrysler. Chairman Fiat Chrysler John Elkann dan CEO PSA Group Carlos Tavares akan menjalankan peran yang sama di perusahaan baru."Dewan Pengawas Peugeot S.A. dan Dewan Direksi Fiat Chrysler Automobile telah dengan suara bulat sepakat untuk bekerja menuju kombinasi penuh dari bisnis masing-masing dengan cara merger 50/50," kata kedua perusahaan dalam pernyataan tertulis seperti dikutip dari Autonews.com, Kamis (31/10).Fiat Chrysler merupakan pemilik merek Fiat, Dodge, Ram, Chrysler, Alfa Romeo, Maserati, dan Jeep. Sedangkan PSA Group punya merek Peugeot, DS, Opel, dan Vauxhall.Penyatuan produsen asal Amerika Serikat dan Prancis ini bakal menempatkannya di antara produsen raksasa dunia. Bila penjualan Fiat Chrysler dan PSA Group digabung jumlahnya 8,7 juta unit, itu di atas General Motors 8,3 juta unit namun masih di bawah Volkswagen Group dan Toyota yang melebihi 10 juta unit.Pengumuman ini hanya berlangsung lima bulan setelah Fiat Chrysler menunda potensi merger dengan kompatriot PSA Group, Renault. (fea)

Fiat Chrysler and Parent Peugeot Agree to Merge
01 Nov 2019, 12:03 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of a Jeep brand. (CNN Indonesia / Safir Makki)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Fiat Chrysler Automobiles and the owner of Peugeot, PSA Group, announced they would merge and set up a new company. The companies are each owned 50 percent by the shareholders of both producers. The merger, which is said to be inaugurated in a few weeks, will create a new automotive entity that employs 410 thousand people with a combined income of US $ 190 billion. The new company will have a head office in the Netherlands which is currently also the location of the Fiat Chrysler headquarters. Fiat Chrysler Chairman John Elkann and PSA Group CEO Carlos Tavares will assume the same role in the new company. "The Peugeot SA Supervisory Board and the Fiat Chrysler Automobile Board of Directors have unanimously agreed to work towards the full combination of their respective businesses by merging 50 / 50, "the two companies said in a written statement as quoted from Autonews.com, Thursday (10/31). Chrysler's Fiat is the owner of the Fiat, Dodge, Ram, Chrysler, Alfa Romeo, Maserati, and Jeep brands. While PSA Group has the brands Peugeot, DS, Opel, and Vauxhall. The unification of producers from the United States and France will place it among the world's giant producers. When the sales of Fiat Chrysler and PSA Group are combined at 8.7 million units, it is above General Motors 8.3 million units but still below Volkswagen Group and Toyota which exceeds 10 million units. This announcement only takes place five months after Fiat Chrysler delays the potential merger with compatriot PSA Group, Renault. (fea)
